Class PADate

java.lang.Object
  PADate

public class PADate
extends java.lang.Object

The class PADate represents a single date.

Constructor Detail

PADate

public PADate()
Constructs a new PADate object that represents the current date.

PADate

public PADate(int year,
              int month,
              int dayOfMonth)
Constructs a new PADate object that represents a date with the specified year, month and day of month. It is assumed that the arguments are valid year, month and day of month values.

Parameters:
year - The year of the date, e.g. 2010.
month - The month between 1 and 12, e.g. 7 (for July).
dayOfMonth - The day of the month between 1 and 31, e.g. 23.
Method Detail

nextDayOfWeek

public PADate nextDayOfWeek(java.lang.String dayOfWeek)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Returns a PADate object that represents the next date that falls on the specified day of week following this PADate object. For example, if this PADate object represents "FRI 01/10/2010" and "SUN" is passed in as dayOfWeek, then the method returns a PADate object that represents "SUN 03/10/2010". If this PADate object represents "FRI 01/10/2010" and "FRI" is passed in as dayOfWeek, then the method returns a PADate object that represents "FRI 08/10/2010".

Parameters:
dayOfWeek - A String that represents the day of the week to return. Pass in Strings like "SUN", "MON", "TUE", "WED", "THU", "FRI", "SAT"
Returns:
A PADate object that represents the next day of week following this PADate object or null if the argument dayOfWeek is not valid.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

An integer that represents the year of this PADate object.

getMonth

public int getMonth()
Returns an integer that represents the month of this PADate object. For example, if this PADate object represents "FRI 01/10/2010", then 10 is returned.

Returns:
An integer that represents the month of this PADate object.

getDayOfMonth

public int getDayOfMonth()
Returns an integer that represents the day of the month of this PADate object. For example, if this PADate object represents "FRI 01/10/2010", then 1 is returned.

Returns:
An integer that represents the day of the month of this PADate object.

getDayOfWeek

public java.lang.String getDayOfWeek()
Returns a string that represents the day of the week of this PADate object. The returned string is one of the following: "SUN", "MON", "TUE", "WED", "THU", "FRI", "SAT".

Returns:
A string that represents the day of the week of this PADate object.

equals

public boolean equals(PADate anotherDate)
Returns true if the date represented by this PADate object is the same as the date represented by the PADate object anotherDate and false otherwise.

Parameters:
anotherDate - The PADate object to be compared against this PADate object.
Returns:
true if the date represented by this PADate object is the same as the date represented by anotherDate and false otherwise.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a String representation of this PADate object in the following format: dd/mm/yyyy. For example, for Oct 1, 2010 the method returns "01/10/2010".

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
A String representation of this PADate object.
